Class Connection<D extends ProtoN & Field & Normalizable>

java.lang.Object
org.interworldtransport.cladosG.Connection<D>
Type Parameters:
D - ProtoN child class is used in the inner maps for weights of blades. (Linear Combinations)
All Implemented Interfaces:
Modal, Unitized
public final class Connection<D extends ProtoN & Field & Normalizable> extends Object implements Unitized, Modal
This class is essentially a connection patching the basis of one algebra to the basis of another. Think about Cristoffel coefficients and you get the rough idea. As such, there will always be two different algebras with two different Feet.

This class has a usage doc with the primary scenario that drives its design. Rather than duplicate the explanation from there to here and risk getting the documentation out of sync, check out the Connection usage page.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Field Details

    • algebra1

      protected Algebra algebra1
      The outer context for this Frame is an Algebra containing a basis with blades to BE represented as a linear combination other blades. This first algebra is the image space of the map of maps.

    • algebra2

      protected Algebra algebra2
      The inner context for this Frame is an Algebra containing a basis with blades to act IN a linear combination of blades. This second algebra is the domain space of the map of maps.

      NOTE there is no reason why algebra2 can't be the same as algebra1. This is typical of maps that represent rotations, translations, reflections, and so on.

  • Constructor Details

    • Connection

      public Connection(Algebra pA1, Algebra pA2, CladosField pMode, Cardinal pCard)
      Construct a Connection with everything required being provided up front except the numbers acting as weights for linear combinations. Without numbers, assume the two bases connect directly. For example E1 in algebra1 is E1 in algebra2... and so on.

      Note: Because the two algebras can be of different sizes there is an asymmetry in the map of maps due to how 'equivalent' blades are found in the filter on the second algebra. There can be blades in the inner algebra that are never found which leaves the Scale for the outer blade set to ZERO. If the outer algebra is smaller (e.g. Cl(3,0,0)) while the inner algebra is larger (e.g. Cl(3,0,1)) then there are a number of blades in the outer algebra with ZERO scales in the map of maps. If the outer algebra is larger than the inner one, the same thing happens because no equivalent blade is found in the inner stream's filter.

      Parameters:
      pA1 - Algebra #1 providing context
      pA2 - Algebra #2 providing context
      pMode - Precision mode used by numbers in the transformation maps.
      pCard - Cardinal used by the numbers in the transformation maps.

  • Method Details

    • blade1PairStream

      public Stream<Blade> blade1PairStream()
      This stream should produce the same output (blades from algebra1) as bladeStream(), but it does so by looking at the mapOfBlades instead of the mapOfMaps. That means when you get the corresponding value from the pair you get a single blade from algebra2.

      The counterpart stream is blade2PairStream().

      Returns:
      Stream of Blades from algebra1 that appear as keys in mapOfMaps

    • blade2PairStream

      public Stream<Blade> blade2PairStream()
      This stream would produce output blades from algebra2 like bladeStream() if mapOfMaps was transposed. It does so by looking at the mapOfBlades instead. That means when you get the corresponding key from the pair you get a single blade from algebra1.

      The counterpart stream is blade1PairStream().

      Returns:
      Stream of Blades from algebra2 that appear any Scale in mapOfMaps.

    • bladeStream

      public Stream<Blade> bladeStream()
      This is the blade stream of the outer map. These blades from algebra1 are keys paired up with Scales using algebra2.

      Returns:
      Stream of Blades from algebra1 that are in the outer map

    • cast

      public Monad cast(Monad pM)
      A monad in one algebra is remapped to another algebra using a Connection.

      Cast involves turning a monad's scale from a map defined in terms of blades of algebra1 into blades of algebra2. Where a blade in pM's scale matches a blade in the outer mapOfMaps basis, the weight from pM's scale is used to weight the inner map. Once all pM's blades are considered, the inner maps are summed and the result becomes the new Scale for pM.

      See the usage documentation for Connection for more details.

      Parameters:
      pM - Monad to be cast
      Returns:
      Monad transformed by the cast operation

    • getAlgebra

      public Algebra getAlgebra(boolean pOuter)
      Retrieve a reference to one of the algebras used in this object. The boolean input picks between outer/inner (algebra1/algebra2) choices.

      Parameters:
      pOuter - boolean True returns the outer map's algebra, False returns the inner maps algebra
      Returns:
      Algebra (Either the first or second one depending on the boolean)

      public Cardinal getCardinal()
      Simple gettor method for the Cardinal associated with these objects.

      Specified by:
      getCardinal in interface Unitized
      Returns:
      Cardinal in use in this.

      public CladosField getMode()

      Returns:

    • getScale

      public Scale<D> getScale(Blade pB)
      Get the Scale object associated with the blade in the outer layer of the map.

      Parameters:
      pB - Blade to use as the index for finding the Scale map
      Returns:
      Scale of D which extend ProtoN and other numeric interfaces

    • getWeight

      public D getWeight(Blade pB1, Blade pB2)
      Get the weight at the blade pair.

      Parameters:
      pB1 - Blade #1 of the pair (a row) for which to fetch a weight
      pB2 - Blade #2 of the pair (a col) for which to fetch a weight
      Returns:
      D which is just a cladosF number. A child of ProtoN.

    • put

      public Connection<D> put(Blade pB, Scale<D> pS)
      PUT a Blade, Scale key/value pair into the mapOfMaps. Check that the operation is legitimate first, though.

      Parameters:
      pB - Blade to use as the key for finding the Scale map
      pS - Scale of D which extend ProtoN and other numeric interfaces
      Returns:
      Frame of D which extend ProtoN and other numeric interfaces. Basically... this object.

    • remove

      public Connection<D> remove(Blade pB)
      Remove a Blade, Scale key/value pair into the mapOfMaps. Check for legitimate use isn't needed, though, because remove fails quietly if the key isn't present.

      Parameters:
      pB - Blade to use as the key for finding the Scale map
      Returns:
      Connection of D which extend ProtoN and other numeric interfaces. Basically... this object.

    • zeroAll

      protected Connection<D> zeroAll(CladosField pMode)
      This method causes all coefficients to be set to zero re-using their cardinals.

      Parameters:
      pMode - CladosField mode in which the numbers operate.
      Returns:
      Connection after it has had all the numbers zero'd out.

    • zeroAll

      protected Connection<D> zeroAll(CladosField pMode, Cardinal pCard)
      This method causes all coefficients to be set to zero using the new cardinal.

      Parameters:
      pMode - CladosField mode in which the numbers operate.
      pCard - Cardinal to use when rebuilding the numbers.
      Returns:
      Connection after it has had all the numbers zero'd out.
